snippet: Some legislators and advocacy groups in France are demanding the legalization of surrogates to help disabled people have sex, but critics see a kind of prostitution.
abstract: Grenoble Journal; some French legislators and advocacy groups in France are demanding legalization of surrogates to help disabled people have sex; critics call practice a kind of prostitution.

byline.contributor: Stefania Rousselle contributed reporting from Vedène, France.

lead_paragraph: Some legislators and advocacy groups in France are demanding the legalization of surrogates to help disabled people have sex, but critics see a kind of prostitution.

headline.main: Disabled People Say They, Too, Want a Sex Life, and Seek Help in Attaining It
headline.print_headline: Disabled People Say They, Too, Want a Sex Life, and Seek Help in Attaining It
